{

}
break;

Is there? No i dont think so , but thanks for sharing that with us as he may not know that. :D[/quote]

item.title: I have 3 questions about coding!
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

[quote=“tobias222, post:3, topic:162536”]try this for the case…

case 7321: //low level train portal
teleportToX = 3225;
teleportToY = 3218;
sendMessage("Welcome to low level train.");
break;

Brackets arent needed in cases…[/quote]

If there is an if statement in there, ya there is.

case 7321: //low level train portal
if (playerRights >= 1) {
teleportToX = 3225;
teleportToY = 3218;
sendMessage(“Welcome to low level train.”);
} else {
sendMessage(“Harharhahrhahhaahhjuwehrihseiurfhsndfjsveursaert”);
}
break;

item.title: I have 3 questions about coding!
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

try this for the case…

case 7321: //low level train portal
teleportToX = 3225;
teleportToY = 3218;
sendMessage("Welcome to low level train.");
break;

Brackets arent needed in cases…

Also, it may be in object click two… which means the second button on the drop down menu at right click.

So… cut (right click and click cut , or ctrl + X)

ctrl + f:

object click one

Then it would look like this:

/*OBJECT CLICK ONE*/

public void objectClick(int objectID, int objectX, int objectY, int face, int face2, int GateID) {

   if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("admin"))
      println_debug("atObject: "+objectX+","+objectY+" objectID: "+objectID); 

switch(objectID) {

Under that hit enter, then paste this:

case 7321: //low level train portal
teleportToX = 3225;
teleportToY = 3218;
sendMessage("Welcome to low level train.");
break;

So… it will look like this:

/*OBJECT CLICK ONE*/

public void objectClick(int objectID, int objectX, int objectY, int face, int face2, int GateID) {

   if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("admin"))
      println_debug("atObject: "+objectX+","+objectY+" objectID: "+objectID); 

switch(objectID) {

case 7321: //low level train portal
teleportToX = 3225;
teleportToY = 3218;
sendMessage("Welcome to low level train.");
break;

Hope it helped…

item.title: I have 3 questions about coding!
item.dc:creator: @untelo untelo
item.description:
@untelo wrote:

Dunno about ports, to add objects:

In client.java, look for this.

public void NewObjects

Then add objects like this

[code]public void NewObjects() {

AddGlobalObject(2910, 9910, 849, -1, 10);//Spear Wall @ smith
AddGlobalObject(2909, 9910, 849, -1, 10);//Spear Wall @ smith
AddGlobalObject(2907, 9910, 849, -1, 10);//Spear Wall @ smith[/code]

AddGlobalObject(object X, object Y, object ID, object face, 10);[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 04, 2007, 07:36:34 AM[/size][hr]For that case u tried:

case 7321: if (objectX == UR OBJECT X HERE && objectY == UR OBJECT Y HERE) { teleportToX = 3225; teleportToY = 3218; sendMessage("Welcome to training area!") } break;

item.title: I have 3 questions about coding!
item.dc:creator: @snowycards snowycards
item.description:
@snowycards wrote:

So my first question

  1. How do i make portals work? (makeGlobalObjects and cases etc…)
    wasted 2 hours trying to figure out and still dont know how lol

heres what i tried so far:

case 7321: //low level train portal
{
teleportToX = 3225;
teleportToY = 3218;
sendMessage(“Welcome to low level train.”);
}
break;

and later in client.java

makeGlobalObject(2602, 3101, 7321, 0, 10);//low level train

  1. How do i change the emote names, and what they do? Cause when i go to the emote list, i want to make an emote called “Train” that teles you somewhere

  2. How do i stop an npc from attacking someone and moving out of position?

THANKS!!!

Read full topic
